  8 /*global Mustache */

 10 // templates.example, templates.includes
 11 
 12 /**
 13  * @file This file contains the base MustacheComb class.
 14  * @author <a href="matthewkastor@gmail.com">Matthew Kastor</a>
 15  * @version 20121030
 16  * @requires events
 17  * @requires util
 18  * @requires fs
 19  * @requires path
 20  * @requires mustache
 21  * @requires textTransformers
 22  * @exports MustacheComb
 23  */
 24 
 25 'use strict';
 26 var events, util, fs, path;
 27 
 28 events = require('events');
 29 util   = require('util');
 30 fs     = require('fs');
 31 path   = require('path');
 32 
 33 /**
 34  * The Base MustacheComb class. The templates
 35  *  and tag handlers shown in their registries will be loaded so, if
 36  *  you want to use this class directly then you'll need to reference
 37  *  your own tag handler and template registries.
 38  * @class
 39  * @param {Array} views An array of view objects. Defaults to an empty array.
 40  * @requires events
 41  * @requires util
 42  * @requires fs
 43  * @requires path
 44  * @requires mustache
 45  * @requires textTransformers
 46  * @example
 47  *  var MustacheComb, comb;
 48  *  
 49  *  MustacheComb = require('atropa-mustache-comb').MustacheComb;
 50  *  
 51  *  comb = new MustacheComb();
 52  *  
 53  *  // adds handling of "thingy" tags.
 54  *  // this function must be appended to the prototype in order
 55  *  // for the addTagHandlerFunction to work properly
 56  *  // "thingy" tags will be replaced with their original text content
 57  *  // concatenated with "woop woop!!"
 58  *  MustacheComb.prototype.formatThingy = function (text) {
 59  *      return text + ' woop woop!!';
 60  *  };
 61  *  comb.addTagHandlerFunction('thingy', 'formatThingy');
 62  *  
 63  *  // adds "wonderful" template by string
 64  *   comb.addTemplateByString('wonderful', 'OMFG!! OMFG!! {{greatNews}}\r\n' +
 65  *       '{{#thingy}}Ain\'t it great news{{/thingy}}\r\n{{>sig}}');
 66  *  
 67  *  // you could also just add string templates directly to the templates
 68  *  // property
 69  *  // comb.templates.wonderful = 'OMFG!! OMFG!! {{greatNews}}\r\n' +
 70  *  //     '{{#thingy}}Ain\'t it great news{{/thingy}}\r\n{{>sig}}';
 71  *  
 72  *  // if the wonderful template were in a file called wonderful.mustache
 73  *  // then we could add it with
 74  *  // comb.addTemplateByFile('wonderful', 'wonderful.mustache', 'utf8');
 75  *  
 76  *  // a view is just an object.
 77  *  var sticker = {};
 78  *  sticker.greatNews = 'I got a free sticker!';
 79  *  sticker.signature = 'Huzzah!';
 80  *  
 81  *  // add a view by pushing it onto the views array
 82  *  comb.views.push(
 83  *      sticker,
 84  *      { 'greatNews' : 'I got a coconut!', 'signature' : 'Jimmy!' },
 85  *      { 'greatNews' : 'I got a penny!', 'signature' : 'Jane!' }
 86  *  );
 87  *  
 88  *  // to render views you need to define a renderer function
 89  *  // this renderer function does not have to be appended to the
 90  *  // MustacheComb prototype but I find it convenient to do so.
 91  *  // the renderer function will take a view, and render it to the screen,
 92  *  // to a file, or however you see fit. This renderer function will
 93  *  // then be given as the argument to renderViews which will pass it
 94  *  // each view. Or you can do something more complex and confusing.
 95  *  
 96  *  MustacheComb.prototype.renderer = function renderer(view) {
 97  *      var out, mustacheTemplateParts;
 98  *      // the generic page structure used repeatedly.
 99  *      mustacheTemplateParts = {
100  *          "sig" : view.signature
101  *      };
102  *      out = this.Mustache.to_html(
103  *          this.templates.wonderful,
104  *          this.mustacheTagHandlers,
105  *          mustacheTemplateParts);
106  *      console.log(out);
107  *  };
108  *  
109  *  comb.renderViews(comb.renderer);
110  *  
111  */
112 function MustacheComb(views) {
113     events.EventEmitter.call(this);
114     
115     var my = this;
116     
117     my.textTransformers= require('atropa-text-transformers');
118     my.Mustache        = require('mustache');
119     my.views           = views || [];
120     
121     /**
122      * Contains functions for handling mustache tags.
123      * @type {Object}
124      */
125     my.mustacheTagHandlers = {};
126     
127     /**
128      * Mustache Templates
129      * @type {Object}
130      */
131     my.templates = {
132         "example"  : "<pre>{{{codeBody}}}</pre>",
133         "includes" : "{{>includes}}"
134     };
135     
136     /**
137      * Adds a template file to the templates object.
138      * @param {String} templateName The template name will become the property of
139      *  this.templates which refers to the template loaded.
140      * @param {String} pathToTemplate The path to the template file.
141      * @param {String} encoding The encoding of the template file. Valid values are the same as
142      *  valid values for fs.readFileSync. Defaults to utf8.
143      */
144     my.addTemplateByFile = function(templateName, pathToTemplate, encoding) {
145         encoding = encoding || 'utf8';
146         my.templates[templateName] = String(fs.readFileSync(path.resolve(pathToTemplate), encoding));
147     };
148     
149     /**
150      * Adds a template string to the templates object.
151      * @param {String} templateName The template name will become the property of
152      *  this.templates which refers to the template loaded.
153      * @param {String} template The template.
154      */
155     my.addTemplateByString = function(templateName, template) {
156         my.templates[templateName] = template;
157     };
158     
159     /**
160      * Adds a handler function for mustache tags. You will be responsible
161      *  for generating whatever you want the tag to be replaced with. In
162      *  general, the text can be run through mustache to parse any tags in
163      *  it or tags can be used as markers for where you're going to
164      *  programatically generate content and insert it.
165      * @function
166      * @param {String} handles The name of the tag to handle {{#whatever}}{{/whatever}}
167      * @param {String} func The name of a function which has been added
168      *  to the MustacheComb prototype. It will receive two arguments: text, and
169      *  whatever. Text is the text content from within the mustache tag.
170      * @see MustacheComb
171      */
172     my.addTagHandlerFunction = function(handles, func) {
173         my.mustacheTagHandlers[handles] = function() {
174             return function(text, whatever) {
175                 return my[func](text, whatever);
176             };
177         };
178     };
179     
180     my.addTagHandlerFunction('example', 'formatExample');
181     my.addTagHandlerFunction('include', 'mustacheIncluder');
182     my.addTagHandlerFunction('includeExample', 'includeExample');
183 }
184 util.inherits(MustacheComb, events.EventEmitter);
185 
186 /**
187  * Tag handler for the example tag. Formats the text for html
188  *  and prettification.
189  * @function`
190  * @param {String} text A string of text (example code) to process.
191  */
192 MustacheComb.prototype.formatExample = function formatExample(text) {
193     var my, parts, offset, code, html;
194     
195     my = this;
196     
197     // normalizing line endings
198     text  = my.textTransformers.convertEOL(text, '\n');
199     // creating an array of lines.
200     parts = text.split('\n');
201     // converting any tabs in white space preceeding the line, into four spaces.
202     parts = parts.map(function (text) {
203         return my.textTransformers.normalizeWhiteSpace(text);
204     });
205     // Since indentation in the article is directly transferred to the displayed 
206     // example, we may need to remove some white space. (thinks of shift+tab).
207     offset = my.textTransformers.getOffset(parts[0]);
208     parts  = parts.map(function(text) {
209         return my.textTransformers.offsetWhiteSpace(text, offset);
210     });
211     // creating a string from an array of lines.
212     code = parts.join('\n');
213     // filtering out characters that screw up the html.
214     code = code.replace(/[<]/g, '<');
215     // Formatting the data into html.
216     html = my.Mustache.to_html(
217         my.templates.example, {
218         codeBody  : code
219     });
220     return html;
221 };
222 
223 /**
224  * Base Function for including files. Fetches file contents.
225  * @param {String} relPath The path to the file to include.
226  * @returns Returns the contents of the file or an html link to the unreadable
227  *  path.
228  */
229 MustacheComb.prototype.includeFile = function includeFile(relPath) {
230     var out;
231         
232     relPath = relPath.trim();
233     
234     try {
235         out = String(fs.readFileSync(relPath));
236     } catch (e) {
237         console.log('  MustacheComb.includeFile : ');
238         console.log(String(e));
239         out = '<p>File not found at <a href="' + relPath + '"><code>' + relPath + '</code></a></p>';
240     }
241     return out;
242 };
243 
244 /**
245  * Function for including example code from files.
246  * @param {String} text The path to the file to include.
247  * @returns Returns the contents of the file formatted for HTML.
248  */
249 MustacheComb.prototype.includeExample = function includeExample(relPath) {
250     var out;
251     out = this.includeFile(relPath);
252     out = this.formatExample(out);
253     return out;
254 };
255 
256 /**
257  * Function for including files. Files may contain mustache tags.
258  * @param {String} text The path to the file to include.
259  * @returns Returns the contents of the file.
260  */
261 MustacheComb.prototype.mustacheIncluder = function mustacheIncluder(relPath) {
262     var out;
263     // the text of the include tag is a path.
264     out = this.includeFile(relPath);
265     // Run the output through Mustache to parse any mustache tags it may contain.
266     out = this.Mustache.to_html(this.templates.includes, this.mustacheTagHandlers, {includes : out});
267     return out;
268 };
269 
270 /**
271  * Renders views from this.views objects array.
272  * @function
273  * @property {Function} callback A callback function to perform on each view.
274  *  The callback receives  the rendered view. The callback could write the view
275  *  to a file, store it in a variable, etc.
276  */
277 MustacheComb.prototype.renderViews = function renderViews(callback) {
278     var my = this;
279     this.views.forEach(function (view) {
280         my.emit('view render attempt ', {"view" : view});
281         callback.call(my, view);
282         my.emit('view rendered ', {"view" : view});
283     });
284 };
285 
286 exports.MustacheComb = MustacheComb;
